title: Handling Setbacks
description: Explore how you support each other through disappointments and setbacks.

questions.text: When I experience a setback, my first reaction is usually...
choices: Disappointment that I need to sit with
Analyzing what went wrong
Wanting to talk it through with you
Pushing forward and trying again

therapeutic.rationale: Initial setback reactions reveal processing styles. Disappointment-sitters need emotional space; analyzers need understanding; talkers need connection; pushers need action. Knowing your partner's pattern helps you respond appropriately.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different setback reactions require flexibility. The pusher may not understand why the sitter needs time; the talker may overwhelm the analyzer. Give each other grace.
therapeutic.whenSame: Matched setback reactions create natural understanding of what each other needs when things go wrong.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What's your first reaction to setbacks? Does your partner respond in a way that helps?

questions.text: After a disappointment, I need you to...
choices: Just be with me without trying to fix it
Help me see the bigger picture
Remind me of my strengths
Give me space then check in later

therapeutic.rationale: Support needs after disappointment vary. Presence-needers want companionship; perspective-needers want reframing; strength-reminders want affirmation; space-then-checkin types need a sequence. Wrong support can feel dismissive or intrusive.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different disappointment support needs require explicit communication. Ask what would actually help rather than assuming.
therapeutic.whenSame: Matched support needs make comforting each other after disappointments intuitive.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What do you need from your partner after a disappointment? Have you told them?

questions.text: What helps me recover from setbacks is...
choices: Time and self-compassion
Understanding what I can learn from it
Support and encouragement from you
Getting back on track with small steps

therapeutic.rationale: Recovery approaches reflect resilience patterns. Time-needers require patience; learners extract value; support-seekers need connection; action-takers need movement. Understanding your partner's recovery path helps you support appropriately.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different recovery approaches are all valid. The action-taker may not understand the time-needer's pace. Respect each other's process.
therapeutic.whenSame: Matched recovery approaches create synchronized healing from setbacks.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What helps you recover from setbacks? Is your partner able to support that process?

questions.text: When you're going through a setback, I want to...
choices: Be there for you however you need
Help you see you'll get through this
Take things off your plate to lighten the load
Let you process while staying close

therapeutic.rationale: Support-giving instincts reflect care styles. Adaptive supporters follow partner's lead; hope-givers provide perspective; load-lighteners offer practical help; close-waiters offer patient presence. All are caring responses.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Your support instinct may not match what your partner needs. Be willing to adjust your approach.
therapeutic.whenSame: Matched support-giving and receiving creates natural comfort during difficult times.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How do you naturally want to support your partner through setbacks? Is that what they need?

choices: Are opportunities for growth if we let them be
Are hard but survivable with the right support
Can make us stronger together
Are inevitable and we shouldn't be too hard on ourselves

therapeutic.rationale: Beliefs about setbacks shape how we process them. Growth-opportunity seers extract value; survivability believers maintain hope; stronger-together believers leverage partnership; inevitability accepters practice self-compassion. All are healthy frames.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different setback philosophies can complement each other, offering multiple sources of comfort.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared setback philosophy creates aligned approach to navigating life's disappointments.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What do you believe about setbacks? How does that belief help you?
